title: Tiwi (1979) Genesis Portion
description: Tiwi is an Australian Aboriginal language spoken by the Tiwi people on the Tiwi Islands, within sight of the coast of northern Australia. It is one of about 10% of Australian languages still being frequently learned by children.
provider: The Institute of Linguistics Aboriginal Branch

language.name: Tiwi
language.area: Northern Territory, Bathurst and Melville Islands, Nguiu.
